ul.li: We need a signaling server because game host must have some info from client before establishing the second half of the connection
Signalling server should possibly store some game state to support

switch.text: We need a signaling server because game host must have some info...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 358px; height: 1px; padding-top: 720px; margin-left: 452px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 336px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

ol.li: Game Host is initialized with code from webserver by visiting url
Game Host sends multiple webrtc offers to signalling server and gets a room code in return
Players scan QR Code from the Game Host on the TV
QR Code loads game client website with Game Host connection data on players devices
Atlernative: Player visits url and types room code
Game Clients send webrtc connection answer to signalling server

li.span: Signalling Server sends Game Client webrtc offer to Game Host
Signalling Server responds with stored Game Host webrtc offer

ol.li: Peers will establish a connection (possibly with help of STUN server)

switch.text: Game Host is initialized with code from webserver by visitin...
